listings.description:
Benefits

Visa Sponsorship if necessary
Relocation Assistance
Resume Enhancement Tips
Interview Preparation

About the company:

This German software development company was established relatively recently, in 2018. Shortly thereafter, the startup received millions in seed funding to grow the team and further advance its SaaS product, which is aimed at reducing the cost and duration of projects in the construction industry. The goal of the team is to enable the construction of better and cheaper real estate.

Your Role:

The company is on the hunt for a Senior Python Software Developer who is eager to apply their engineering skills toward creating software that will transform the construction industry. For back-end services, the dev team uses Python, Django, and Postgres in Docker containers. They also use JS, React, Bootstrap, Sass, and Webpack for client-side programming. AWS (Elastic Beanstalk), GitHub, CircleCI, and Codacy are in the team’s tech stack as well.

As a Senior Python Engineer, you’ll be leading a team of talented and ambitious back-end developers in the heart of Munich, Germany. More specifically, your responsibilities will include:

  • Supporting your engineering team members personally and professionally;
  • Maintaining a highly effective way of building software, including the monitoring and logging of large systems;
  • Delivering the best possible user experience by continuously shipping new features for the company’s cloud platform;
  • Building new features, as well as testing, deployment, and monitoring of your code.

Your qualification:

  • Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science or a closely related field;
  • 5+ years of software development experience using Python;
  • Experience with one of the popular Python frameworks, such as Django or Flask;
  • Experience building a web app in a complex B2B domain;
  • Experience working in an agile development environment;
  • In-depth knowledge of architectural patterns, DevOps, and AWS;
  • Experience leading a small team of devs/engineers;
  • Fluency in English;
  • German language skills would be a plus.

Relocation support:

You don't just get a new full-time job, you are becoming a part of something bigger – the team of awesome techies, the community, where every single individual matters. We care about you and aim to make your IT job abroad and IT relocation as smooth as possible. That’s why visa sponsorship, coverage of flight, and assistance with searching for a home for you and your family are a vital part of our support as an IT recruitment agency in your job relocation.

Additional information:

Germany has one of the most advanced economies in the EU, that turns your relocation to Munich into a really great and unique experience. You’ll be pleasantly surprised by generous social security benefits and high quality of life, effective educational, medical and housing systems of the excellent standard. Munich is a significant IT center that always offers a variety of IT jobs, tech conferences, and educational events to participate in. In addition, excellent national and international transport links give endless opportunities to travel.

Contacts

For additional details on this role contact - Daria Tymokhina

daria.tymokhina
daria.tymokhina@relocateme.tech

Have a great day!

Benefits

Visa Sponsorship if necessary
Relocation Assistance
Resume Enhancement Tips
Interview Preparation

About the company:

This company is a definite leader in online trade field. It was founded in 2006 and since than it has grown up till 35 offices all around the world. Portugal, South Africa, UAE, Argentina, Poland, Ukraine, Philippines and many other countries work with this e-commerce platform. Thanks to the company and its product, to buy or sell anything you like is now super easy. This business never stop improving and become better and better every day by challenging itself. The team is ready to experiment and improvise to reach the success.

Your Role:

As a SRE with relocation to Lisbon you are going to be a part of a great business which connects millions of people all around the world. By taking this position you will join an experienced team of open-minded and motivated techies, you will get a chance to show your skills and share you background and experience. Your main responsibilities are:

  • Ensuring scalability, deployment, performance of  the platform for buying and selling services and goods;
  • Architecting, building and implementing of infrastructure services in order to make the platform grow;
  • Building various tools for simplifying and speeding up everyday, routine operations;
  • To do your best to push the platform to higher level;
  • Cooperating with Engineering Department to evangelize scalable and sensible design of systems;
  • Working closely with other departments and teams to support worldwide app groups.

Your qualification:

  • More than 3 years experience in the relevant field;
  • Great experience with scaling and building of High-Traffic Web Applications;
  • Experience with NoSQL, SQL, DNS, CDN;
  • Excellence with (at least one) Ruby, Go, Python, Java;
  • Proficiency at Puppet, Ansible or Chef and other frameworks for configuration management;
  • Superior knowledge and experience with Networking Systems and Unix/Linux;
  • Knowledge of cloud based solutions (e.g. AWS etc).

Relocation support:

You don't just get a new full-time job, you are becoming a part of something bigger – the team of awesome techies, the community, where every single individual matters. We care about you and aim to make your IT job abroad and IT relocation as smooth as possible. That’s why visa application process support, document consulting, coverage of flight, visa sponsorship for you and your family are a vital part of our support as an IT recruiting agency in your job relocation.

Additional information:

Lisbon is an incredibly beautiful city with a stunning architectural heritage of many styles, colourful trams, lovely squares which will make your day. It is considered to be one of the oldest cities of the world and it is the oldest city of Western Europe. Lisbon is the biggest city and port of Portugal. This place also has a warm climate: in winter the mean air temperature is 18 degrees. There are many different entertainments like Portugal Half Marathon, Portuguese-style bullfighting and, of course, football.  This city will make you love it and never forget.

Contacts

For additional details on this role contact - Iuliia Shyshka

shishechka201
iuliia.shyshka@relocateme.tech

Have a great day!

Benefits

Visa Sponsorship if necessary
Relocation Assistance
Resume Enhancement Tips
Interview Preparation

About the company:

This company is a definite leader in online trade field. It was founded in 2006 and since than it has grown up till 35 offices all around the world. Portugal, South Africa, UAE, Argentina, Poland, Ukraine, Philippines and many other countries work with this e-commerce platform. Thanks to the company and its product, to buy or sell anything you like is now super easy. This business never stop improving and become better and better every day by challenging itself. The team is ready to experiment and improvise to reach the success.

Your Role:

This Senior Frontend Engineer position with relocation to Lisbon is the where where you will have a possibility to show your background and skills. You will work in cross-cultural team of experienced techies who are able and willing to learn and improve themselves. As soon as you join this team you will be doing researches, suggesting and implementing the best solutions to problems. But you will also be responsible for:

  • Contributing to standards, tools, architecture for the engineering organization;
  • Meeting deadlines and high quality standards;
  • Take part in pushing the platform to the new level by scaling it;
  • Together with other teams do your best to scale and build development modes and fast-release environment;
  • Mentor juniors, help them to develop;
  • Use cutting-edge technologies and tools where it is suitable and possible;
  • Take part in talent attracting and recruiting processes.

Your qualification:

  • At least 5 years experience working in a similar role;
  • At least Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related field;
  • Proficiency at high scale web applications;
  • Having emphasis on a quality of the code, test-driven mindset;
  • Great experience working in TDD driven environment;
  • Superior knowledge and great experience working with JavaScript (ES6);
  • Deep knowledge and experience with building JavaScript applications with React;
  • Experience working with Saga and other React middlewares;
  • Good experience with Node.js and SSR;
  • Understanding of JSON, HTTP(s), REST data transfer protocols;
  • Knowledge of and experience with SASS/CSS and HTML5;
  • Experience working with GULP or Grunt;
  • Experience with Ci/CD pipelines;
  • Experience with PHP/Go, PWA and data layer management with Redux - is a great plus.

Relocation support:

There are many different entertainments like Portugal Half Marathon, Portuguese-style bullfighting and, of course, football.  This city will make you love it and never forget.

About the company:

This Berlin-based company has been changing the food-delivery industry since 2011. More than 1000 team members work here, do their best and share their experience. First-rate investors are also the part of this start-up; they have already raised $1 billion to support this idea. This company is named World’s biggest network in this industry. The platform offers lots of choices with minimum efforts: online order and payment, any food desire can be met.

Your Role:

The company is on the lookout for a Senior Front-End Engineer who is ready to become part of its amazingly diverse Logistics team in Berlin and help build the best food delivery experience in the world. As a Senior Front-End UX Developer, your key responsibilities will include:

  • Building up a design system jointly with the design team and implementing it into a rapidly growing number of products;
  • Identifying interaction patterns across the products and building reusable components and front-end libraries for React, Angular, and Android front ends;
  • Active participation in architecture decisions as well as providing technical front-end leadership;
  • Sharing your knowledge about semantic, high-performance HTML and CSS with other front-end devs in the team;
  • Being an ambassador for consistency, usability, and accessibility of the product interfaces;
  • Close collaboration with product designers and PM’s on scalable front-end solutions and abstract new components for the design system.

Your qualification:

  • At least a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a UX-related field (e.g., Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors, Graphic Design, etc.), or equivalent practical experience;
  • At least 5 years of experience in developing and delivering solutions using front-end technologies;
  • Extensive knowledge of React and/or Angular JavaScript framework(s) and their core principles;
  • Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools, such as Docker and Kubernetes;
  • A firm grasp of the importance of user-centric design and design thinking;
  • Excellence in interaction/visual design and solid skills in the other;
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team;
  • Excellent communication, prioritization, and time-management skills;
  • Fluency in English. 

 

Any of the below is a plus:

  • Experience with Design Systems;
  • Sketch, InVision, and Abstract skills;
  • Experience with Android and/or iOS;
  • Data Visualization experience;
  • Experience with scripting languages, especially Ruby or Python.

Relocation support:

You don't just get a new full-time job, you are becoming a part of something bigger – the team of awesome techies, the community, where every single individual matters. We care about you and aim to make your IT job abroad and IT relocation as smooth as possible. That’s why visa application process support, document consulting, coverage of flight, visa sponsorship for you and your family are a vital part of our support as an IT recruiting agency in your job relocation.

Additional information:

Germany is one of the most advanced economies in the EU, which turns your relocation to Berlin into a really great and unique experience. You’ll be pleasantly surprised by generous social security benefits and high quality of life, effective educational, medical and housing systems of the excellent standard. Berlin is a significant IT center that always offers a variety of IT jobs, tech conferences, and educational events to participate in. Many European and global market leaders like Amazon, eBay, Microsoft, Twitter, Uber, Visa, Zendesk established their branches or offices in Berlin so it might be a perfect place for your innovation, education, and constant growth. In addition, excellent national and international transport links give endless opportunities to travel.

Contacts

For additional details on this role contact - Iuliia Shyshka

Have a great day!

About the company:

This is a Munich-based company dealing with indoor positioning. Their product is being used in more than 25 countries around the world, different customers starting with real estate sphere to manufacturing and museums are satisfied with it, more than 30 company-partners has already tried this indoor technology. Visiting this site clients can calculate floor space online, build visualization without any additional software installation, 3D building is also can be done. Every industry can find something they need at this indoor positioning industry. Almost 150 people are currently working in this company in Munich and, recently opened, New York headquarters.

Your Role:

In this software engineering position, you will be developing the UI app powering the company’s latest mapping system for capturing large indoor spaces (TypeScript, Angular 2+), as well as the back end helping control the mapping on the company’s mapping devices (Python). As a Front-End/Full Stack Engineer, your responsibilities will also include:

  • Developing applications for internal use;
  • Designing interactive and high-performance client-server applications, related to robotics;
  • Maintaining and improving the existing APIs;
  • Helping your colleagues grow professionally.

Your qualification:

  • 3+ years of software development experience;
  • Experience building and implementing client-server and web-server apps;
  • Extensive knowledge of JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, and their most common libraries and frameworks, especially Angular 2+;
  • Passion for robotics; 
  • No problem communicating in English;
  • Willingness to relocate to Munich and work in an international team.

Any of the below is a plus:

  • A Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or any other related field;
  • Experience with Linux in general and Git, Bash in particular;
  • Application debugging and improving skills;
  • Interest in CI/CD, Agile, and DevOps.

Relocation support:

You don't just get a new full-time job, you are becoming a part of something bigger – the team of awesome techies, the community, where every single individual matters. We care about you and aim to make your IT job abroad and IT relocation as smooth as possible. That’s why document consulting and assistance with searching for a home for you and your family are a vital part of our support as an IT recruitment agency in your job relocation. Furthermore, the hiring company provides a relocation bonus and is ready to sponsor your work visa if required.

Additional information:

Germany has one of the most advanced economies in the EU, that turns your relocation to Munich into a really great and unique experience. You’ll be pleasantly surprised by generous social security benefits and high quality of life, effective educational, medical and housing systems of the excellent standard. Munich is a significant IT center that always offers a variety of IT jobs, tech conferences, and educational events to participate in. In addition, excellent national and international transport links give endless opportunities to travel.

Contacts

For additional details on this role contact - Daria Tymokhina

daria.tymokhina
daria.tymokhina@relocateme.tech

Have a great day!

Relocation Assistance
Resume Enhancement Tips
Interview Preparation

About the company:

This company develops and maintains a payment processing platform, which is now used by global corporations like Microsoft and LinkedIn. The solution connects merchants to all popular payment methods, including Visa and Mastercard, and works with several sales channels, both online and offline. In 2018, the platform processed a total volume of €159 billion. As for the company itself, it is a global industry player with an almost 15-year history, 20 offices worldwide, and an innovation-driven team of 800+ employees.

Your Role:

The company is looking for a skilled Java Developer, who is not afraid of challenges and implementing the newest technology to make things work.

After relocation to the company’s headquarters in Amsterdam, you will:

  • Develop, deploy, test, and maintain new features for the payment processing platform;
  • Improve the existing features to make the solution more reliable;
  • Collaborate with the international team on various issues;
  • Identify the needs of both payment senders and receivers and observe the impact of the new features on their user experience.

Your qualification:

Drop us your resume ASAP if you:

  • Have a huge experience with Java and SQL databases (preferably PostgreSQL);
  • Have a hands-on experience building multithreaded apps;
  • Are familiar with the aspects of working on a high-load platform;
  • Pay attention to the detail, are flexible and like working within a team;
  • Won’t have any trouble communicating in English.

Relocation support:

You don't just get a new full-time job, you are becoming a part of something bigger – the team of awesome techies, the community, where every single individual matters. We care about you and aim to make your IT job abroad and IT relocation as smooth as possible. That’s why visa application process support, document consulting, coverage of flight, visa sponsorship for you and your family are a vital part of our support as an IT recruiting agency in your job relocation.

Additional information:

Your Java Developer position with relocation to the Netherlands will take place in the incredible city of surprises, Amsterdam, which is widely acknowledged as one of the greatest small cities in the world. Every part of the city has its own unique character and charm, turning Amsterdam in the fascinating city of tolerance and diversity, where every shade, perspective, and character is appreciated. Over the past 10 years, Amsterdam was promoted as a strong region for business and IT culture: it's home to a thriving tech and ICT industry, where the IT professionals not only enjoy the great quality of life but also a wide variety of opportunities and a great environment for self-development and career growth. At the same time, Amsterdam enjoys one of the lowest costs of living of the European capitals and highly skilled migrants coming to the Netherlands to work, a major fiscal benefit is the 30% ruling tax advantage. In addition, the city is easily accessible with fantastic air, rail and road links; there is excellent high-speed rail service connecting Amsterdam to various cities, so the rest of Europe is practically at the end of the street. Amsterdam is the city of opportunity, so you have to be ready when it presents itself.

Contacts

For additional details on this role contact - Maria Koval

maria@relocateme.tech

Have a great day!

Benefits

Visa Sponsorship if necessary
Relocation Assistance
Resume Enhancement Tips
Interview Preparation

About the company:

This company is an online broker, which allows traders to manage their deals in a modern and convenient way. Since the inception about 10 years ago, it has expanded all across Europe and now operates in 18 countries. More than 400,000 investors have already joined the network, getting access to 50 exchanges in Europe, North America, Asia, and Australia. The online-only approach significantly reduces investors’ expenses, allowing them to buy stocks at wholesale prices.

Your Role:

If you’re ready to develop a system that hundreds of thousands of people use daily, this Java Developer position is for you. Having relocated to Amsterdam, you will:

  • Develop new features, which form the core of the online brokerage system;
  • Improve the existing features and trading tools;
  • Collaborate with Front-End, Product, Marketing, and other teams to make the right technical decisions;
  • Work with a development team on choosing the technologies for building new tools;
  • Put your best effort on keeping the development ecosystem flexible and maintaining the existing codebase.

Your qualification:

The company is waiting for those who:

  • Have a BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or any related field;
  • Have been working with Java for 8+ years;
  • Are familiar with Git, Maven, and SQL databases;
  • Can effectively work within a team.

 

It will be a big plus if you:

  • Know Spring and Hibernate;
  • Have a hands-on experience building distributed apps and APIs;
  • Are interested in financial markets.

Relocation support:

You don't just get a new full-time job, you are becoming a part of something bigger – the team, the community, where every single individual matters. We care about you and aim to make your IT job abroad and IT relocation as smooth as possible. That’s why visa application process support, coverage of flight, and visa sponsorship for you and your family are a vital part of our support as an IT recruiting agency in your job relocation.

Additional information:

Your Senior Back-End Java Developer position with relocation to the Netherlands will take place in the incredible city of surprises, Amsterdam, which is widely acknowledged as one of the greatest small cities in the world. Every part of the city has its own unique character and charm, turning Amsterdam in the fascinating city of tolerance and diversity, where every shade, perspective, and character is appreciated. Over the past 10 years, Amsterdam was promoted as a strong region for business and IT culture: it's home to a thriving tech and ICT industry, where the IT professionals not only enjoy the great quality of life but also a wide variety of opportunities and a great environment for self-development and career growth. At the same time, Amsterdam enjoys one of the lowest costs of living of the European capitals and highly skilled migrants coming to the Netherlands to work, a major fiscal benefit is the 30% ruling tax advantage. In addition, the city is easily accessible with fantastic air, rail and road links; there is excellent high-speed rail service connecting Amsterdam to various cities, so the rest of Europe is practically at the end of the street. Amsterdam is the city of opportunity, so you have to be ready when it presents itself.

Contacts

For additional details on this role contact - Anna Kalniei

About the company:

This company is an online broker, which allows traders to manage their deals in a modern and convenient way. Since the inception about 10 years ago, it has expanded all across Europe and now operates in 18 countries. More than 400,000 investors have already joined the network, getting access to 50 exchanges in Europe, North America, Asia, and Australia. The online-only approach significantly reduces investors’ expenses, allowing them to buy stocks at wholesale prices.

Your Role:

The company currently employs over 200 people, 25% of whom are IT specialists. As a C++ developer, you will be part of its software engineering team working on the development of robust and high performing electronic trading systems. This is a full-time onsite role, so, in order to join the team, you’ll need to relocate to Amsterdam, Europe’s top tech hub. Your responsibilities as a Senior C++ Software Engineer will include:

  • Design and development of trading systems software, unit-testing, code and design inspection;
  • Development of reusable, extensible, and maintainable software that interoperates seamlessly with both current and new architectures;
  • Active participation in and contribution to the activities of the team, including design reviews, code reviews, and mentoring;
  • Demonstrating increasing understanding of trading systems, trading strategies, financial markets, instruments, and industry trends.

Your qualification:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent;
  • 5+ years of C++ development experience in a Linux/Mac OSX environment;
  • Experience with TCP/IP, sоcket-lеvеl prоgramming, lоw-latеncy middleware, STL, multithreadеd prоgramming, and (MySQL-) databasеs;
  • Experience in the electronic trading industry is desirable but not essential;
  • A good grasp of financial electronic markets, trading, and financial instruments would be a plus;
  • Fluency in English.

Relocation support:

In addition, the city is easily accessible with fantastic air, rail and road links; there is excellent high-speed rail service connecting Amsterdam to various cities, so the rest of Europe is practically at the end of the street. About the company:

This company offers an all-in-one admin panel for those who sell something on Amazon. The platform has several versions and includes tools for managing profit, automating PPC campaigns, improving SEO rankings, checking the customer feedback, and so on. Based in Berlin, the company is a part of Amazon's Official Global Solution Provider Network. The product was voted among ‘20 Most Promising E-Commerce Solution Providers’ by CIO Review.

Your Role:

The company's growing DevOps engineering team will be tasked with:

  • Working with Software Development teams to understand the problems they are facing and the solutions they are using. Agree to some architectural standards about how applications are packaged, built and deployed.
  • Creating templates, infrastructure as code and other automation to allow developers to easily implement and manage the chosen solutions.
  • Working with developers to help them move their projects to the new system and learn how to be owners of their code within this new environment.

Your qualification:

  • You have 3+ years' working experience operating production web applications on AWS.
  • You have at least 1 year of working experience with Terraform.
  • You are very comfortable around a UNIX shell, and have experience installing and running Linux.
  • You think like 'Ops' when it comes to Security, high-availability and business continuity. Well managed access keys and tight permission sets get you excited. Passwords in the clear lead to missing heartbeats.
  • You have solid experience using a monitoring system to visualise and make decisions about systems operations. Even better if you have built such a system.
  • You love working with other people and are happy to support lots of engineers without “owning” anything yourself. This is about building DevOps culture and tooling. Not about taking Ops away from Dev.
  • You have recent experience working in a startup, small company, or another somewhat unstructured environment.

 

Bonus points:

  • You are an expert in CI/CD pipelines and have worked in groups of 30+ developers to build out CI/CD tooling and create the culture that leads to its consistent usage.
  • Your a Linux Kernel/Virtualization Guru.
  • You have solid production experience with containerization (Docker) and container orchestration.
  • You have impressive experience building, architecting and/or operating a microservice-based environment that deals with ingesting and querying terabytes of data each day.
  • You’ve worked in a senior role on production implementations with over 250 virtual machines as well as SQL based databases under heavy load.
  • You're a guru of version control systems (Git), building automation (Maven, Jenkins).
  • You are experienced in managing database-servers and/or working with DBA’s.
  • You are experienced with distributed queues and systems.

Additional information:

Germany has one of the most advanced economies in the EU, which turns your relocation to Berlin into a really great and unique experience. You’ll be pleasantly surprised by generous social security benefits and high quality of life, effective educational, medical and housing systems of the excellent standard. Berlin is a significant IT center that always offers a variety of IT jobs, tech conferences, and educational events to participate in. Many European and global market leaders like Amazon, eBay, Microsoft, Twitter, Uber, Visa, and Zendesk established their branches or offices in Berlin, so it might be a perfect place for your innovation, education, and constant growth. In addition, excellent national and international transport links give endless opportunities to travel.

Contacts

For additional details on this role contact - Maria Koval

About the company:

This company offers an all-in-one admin panel for those who sell something on Amazon. The platform has several versions and includes tools for managing profit, automating PPC campaigns, improving SEO rankings, checking the customer feedback, and so on. Based in Berlin, the company is a part of Amazon's Official Global Solution Provider Network. The product was voted among ‘20 Most Promising E-Commerce Solution Providers’ by CIO Review.

Your Role:

The company is on the lookout for a passionate QA Engineer, who will be hyper-focused on the quality of its key products. Performing manual tests (and, if needed, writing automation tests) will be your main responsibility. You will also regularly communicate with Test, Business, Frontend, Backend, and Product teams on quality issues.

Your qualification:

Don’t doubt to apply if you have:

  • 1-3 years’ experience in manual testing for a software-related company (preferably on Agile projects);
  • Proven ability to take ownership and initiative approach to work;
  • Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills.

 

It will also be a big plus if you have:

  • Experience in automation testing;
  • 1 year’s experience in programming in Java or any other language;
  • Experience with the following (or similar) tools: Jenkins, TestNG, Postman/REST APIs, Selenium, Maven.

Additional information:

Germany has one of the most advanced economies in the EU, which turns your relocation to Berlin into a really great and unique experience.
